title: `Cosinor` Model ‚Äî CosinorM
text: `Cosinor` model cosine-based harmonic regression used estimate circadian rhythm parameters. Single-phase equation:       $$y = M + \cos \left(\frac{2\pi t}{\tau} - \phi\right) $$ \(M \): MESOR (mid-line estimating statistic rhythm), intercept \(\): Amplitude, peak deviation M \(t \): Time coordinate within cycle \(\tau \): assumed period length \(\phi \): Acrophase (time--peak), computed fitted sine cosine coefficients Note model parameterized negative phase inside cosine, means derived peak time acrophase corresponds peak time forward midnight (backward). words, acrophase positive, means peak activity time occurs midnight vice versa. Linearized form:      $$\hat{y} = M + \beta x + \gamma z + \epsilon $$ \(\beta = * cos(\phi)\), estimated coefficient cosine term \(x = cos(\frac{2 * \pi * t} {\tau})\), cosine-transformed time \(\gamma = * sin(\phi)\), estimated coefficient sine term \(z = sin(\frac{2 * \pi * t} {\tau})\), sine-transformed time \(\epsilon \): error term Model parameters estimated minimizing residual sum squares: $$RSS = \sum_{=1}^n (y_i - (M + \beta x_i + \gamma z_i))^2$$ default, lm fits via QR decomposition. Acrophase \(\phi\) interpretation:  \(\phi \) derived  $$\phi = \arctan2(\frac{\gamma} {\beta}) $$ Note, \(\phi \) can converted clock time identify peak activity time midnight. model mono-phase (.e., one \(\tau \)), \(\frac{24 (hours)} {\tau} \) number peaks within day. Amplitude \(() \) estimation: Amplitude calculated fitted sine cosine coefficients : $$= \sqrt {(\beta^2 + \gamma^2)}$$
